Implantation
During the week after 
fertilisation, the fertilised egg 
(which is now an embryo) 
moves slowly down the 
fallopian tube and into the 
uterus. It is already growing. 
The embryo attaches 
itself	firmly	to	the	specially	
thickened uterus lining. 
This is called implantation.
